[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Telecommunication Scheduling System (TSS) defines requirements for an automated scheduling platform ensuring efficiency, security, and accessibility.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: TSS supports caller scheduling, supervisor management, system responsiveness, and high availability for telecommunication operations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: TSS integrates with scheduling APIs, authentication systems, and role-based management tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: TSS provides a web-based UI optimized for structured navigation and accessibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: TSS runs on scalable cloud infrastructure with high uptime and load balancing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: TSS uses REST APIs for managing user schedules and permissions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: TSS ensures encrypted session security using TLS 1.3 and real-time notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: TSS optimizes concurrent scheduling operations and updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: TSS supports multilingual interfaces, including English, Spanish, and French.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: TSS links to authentication, reporting, and analytics services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: TSS facilitates scheduling, user role management, notifications, and compliance tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: TSS is designed for callers, supervisors, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: TSS requires stable internet connectivity and role-based authentication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: TSS relies on external authentication, API integrations, and databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Role-Based Access: Assigning permissions based on user roles.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with authentication services for secure user access.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall process scheduling updates through REST APIs.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow supervisors to manage user schedules and permissions (REQ-FUNC-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable users to schedule, modify, and cancel sessions while enforcing updates and access controls (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall notify users of schedule changes and maintain an audit log (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI with structured navigation, mobile responsiveness, and accessibility features.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall respond to schedule queries within 2 seconds for 90% of requests and within 5 seconds for all cases.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain database integrity while handling concurrent scheduling updates (REQ-DB-55).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user schedules, permissions, session logs, and historical changes.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with W3C accessibility and usability standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to data security, privacy, and API best practices.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain 99.5% uptime with automated failover mechanisms and real-time monitoring.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Scheduling, user roles, notifications, and security compliance shall be tested.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: System documentation, UI guidelines, security policies, and compliance reports.
[SEC] 5. References: Industry standards for scheduling systems, W3C compliance, and API security best practices.
